Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your application and for ranking Nursery_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you a place at Nursery_B. Please reply to confirm, and we will send the next steps for enrollment paperwork and scheduling.

conversation.thought: Parent_C is 3rd on Nursery_B’s true priority list (after Parent_E and Parent_B). In this round, I received applications from Parent_C, Parent_A, and Parent_D. Among these, my priority order is Parent_C > Parent_D > Parent_A, so Parent_C is the best available applicant right now. However, Parent_B (ranked above Parent_C) is likely to apply to Nursery_A first (their top choice), and Parent_E (my top) is unlikely to apply to me at all since Nursery_B is their last choice. If I accept Parent_C now, I secure a high-priority match and avoid the risk of ending up with a lower-priority parent later. Given quota=1 and strong immediate interest from Parent_C, accepting is optimal.

Therefore I must reject Parent_A now and suggest they pursue other options/waitlist if available.
